trans-unit.source: Azure AD Privileged Identity Management
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Privileged Identity Management

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Privileged Identity Management lets you manage, control and monitor your privileged identities and their access to resources in Azure AD, and in other Microsoft online services such as Office 365 or Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Privileged Identity Management lets you manage, control and monitor your privileged identities and their access to resources in Azure AD, and in other Microsoft online services such as Office 365 or Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: To enable users to carry out privileged operations, organizations have often needed to give many of their users permanent privileged access in Azure AD, or for Azure or Office 365 resources, or other SaaS apps.
trans-unit.target: To enable users to carry out privileged operations, organizations have often needed to give many of their users permanent privileged access in Azure AD, or for Azure or Office 365 resources, or other SaaS apps.

trans-unit.source: For many customers, this is a growing security risk for their cloud-hosted resources because they cannot sufficiently monitor what those users are doing with their admin privileges.
trans-unit.target: For many customers, this is a growing security risk for their cloud-hosted resources because they cannot sufficiently monitor what those users are doing with their admin privileges.

trans-unit.source: In addition, a compromised user account that has privileged access could impact their overall cloud security.
trans-unit.target: In addition, a compromised user account that has privileged access could impact their overall cloud security.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Privileged Identity Management helps to resolve this risk.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Privileged Identity Management helps to resolve this risk.

trans-unit.target: Discover which users are the Azure AD admins

trans-unit.target: Enable on-demand, "just in time" administrative access to directory resources

trans-unit.source: Get reports about administrator access history and about changes in administrator assignments
trans-unit.target: Get reports about administrator access history and about changes in administrator assignments

trans-unit.source: Get alerts about access to a privileged role
trans-unit.target: Get alerts about access to a privileged role

trans-unit.source: Just in time administrator access
trans-unit.target: Just in time administrator access

trans-unit.source: Historically, you could assign a user to an admin role through the Azure Management Portal or Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Historically, you could assign a user to an admin role through the Azure Management Portal or Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: As a result, that user becomes permanent admin, always active in his or her assigned role.
trans-unit.target: As a result, that user becomes permanent admin, always active in his or her assigned role.

trans-unit.source: This preview adds support for a temporary admin, which is a user who needs to complete an activation process for the assigned role.
trans-unit.target: This preview adds support for a temporary admin, which is a user who needs to complete an activation process for the assigned role.

trans-unit.source: The activation process changes the assignment of the user to a role in Azure AD from inactive to active.
trans-unit.target: The activation process changes the assignment of the user to a role in Azure AD from inactive to active.

trans-unit.source: Enabling Privileged Identity Management for your directory
trans-unit.target: Enabling Privileged Identity Management for your directory

trans-unit.source: You can start using Azure AD Privileged Identity Management by accessing the <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can start using Azure AD Privileged Identity Management by accessing the <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For now, Azure AD Privileged Identity Management only appears in the Microsoft Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: For now, Azure AD Privileged Identity Management only appears in the Microsoft Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: You must be a global administrator to enable Azure AD Privileged Identity Management for a directory.
trans-unit.target: You must be a global administrator to enable Azure AD Privileged Identity Management for a directory.

trans-unit.source: After initializing this extension, you will automatically become the first Security administrator of the directory.
trans-unit.target: After initializing this extension, you will automatically become the first Security administrator of the directory.

trans-unit.source: Only a security administrator can access this extension to manage the access for other administrators.
trans-unit.target: Only a security administrator can access this extension to manage the access for other administrators.

trans-unit.source: During initialization, a tile of Azure AD Privileged Identity Management will be added to the startboard of the Azure Preview portal.
trans-unit.target: During initialization, a tile of Azure AD Privileged Identity Management will be added to the startboard of the Azure Preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Role activation
trans-unit.target: Role activation

trans-unit.source: In order to activate a role, a temporary admin needs to request a time-bound "activation" for the role.
trans-unit.target: In order to activate a role, a temporary admin needs to request a time-bound "activation" for the role.

trans-unit.source: The activation can be requested using the Activate my role option in Azure AD Privileged Identity Management.
trans-unit.target: The activation can be requested using the Activate my role option in Azure AD Privileged Identity Management.

trans-unit.source: An admin who wants to activate a role needs to initialize Azure AD Privileged Identity Management in the Azure Preview portal.
trans-unit.target: An admin who wants to activate a role needs to initialize Azure AD Privileged Identity Management in the Azure Preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Any type of admin can use Azure AD Privileged Identity Management to activate his or her role.
trans-unit.target: Any type of admin can use Azure AD Privileged Identity Management to activate his or her role.

trans-unit.source: Role activation is time-bound.
trans-unit.target: Role activation is time-bound.

trans-unit.source: In the Role Activation settings,you can configure the length of the activation as well as the required information that the admin needs to provide in order to activate the role.
trans-unit.target: In the Role Activation settings,you can configure the length of the activation as well as the required information that the admin needs to provide in order to activate the role.
